result.execSummary:
The defendant Teonia S. Buckhalter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Teonia S. Buckhalter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Teonia S. Buckhalter was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Gregory Bates.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 1 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 2 - Plea of no contest; found guilty by the Court.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the cost; written notice provided to defendant.  Fined $100 + costs; cash bond to apply to fine and all costs.  Balance to be apply to fine & costs due in 16CM1574.  Any balance after that is to be returned to the poster.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Greg Bates.  The case is not resolved.  FPT 02/17/17 @ 11:00 & jury trial 2/20/17 @ 9:00. Bond cont'd.  Clerk D. Smith.
